Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Barack Obama "said black males are two times more likely to be shot by a law enforcement officer than white males" without providing accurate data or evidence to support this statement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide any data or evidence to back up the statement made by Barack Obama.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is no data to support the statement made by Barack Obama, without considering alternative sources or research that may exist.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations or interpretations of the statement made by Barack Obama, such as the possibility that he was referring to all African-Americans rather than just African-American males.
